\subsection{Detailed Description}
Represents a filesystem path. 

The path this represents does not necessarily exists, nor does it have to be valid for the current operating system.

However this object is intended to provided platform independent methods for dealing with file system paths.

\begin{DoxyParagraph}{Example Usage}

\end{DoxyParagraph}
T\-O\-D\-O\-:

Default constructor. 

Creates a new empty \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}. \hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a2f99e6ecbc8012c704a7d59a82e44d7e}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!Path@{Path}}
\index{Path@{Path}!chaos::io::file::Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}}
\subsubsection[{Path}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path\-::\-Path (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const std\-::vector$<$ {\bf chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-T\-F8\-String} $>$ \&}]{components}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a2f99e6ecbc8012c704a7d59a82e44d7e}


Component constructor. 

Creates a new \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} from the given std\-::vector of components.

For example the native Linux path\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
path/to/file.txt
\end{DoxyCode}


Would be passed to this constructor like so\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
std::vector< chaos::str::UTF8String > components;
components.push\_back( \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"} );
components.push\_back( \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"} );
components.push\_back( \textcolor{stringliteral}{"file.txt"} );

\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p( components );
\end{DoxyCode}
 \hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a888031f678ac29c3c068c7c710057809}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!Path@{Path}}

\hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a75296f65ccebe075504744bb01218ac9}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!operator$<$@{operator$<$}}

\subsubsection[{operator$<$}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}bool chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path\-::operator$<$ (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf Path} \&}]{other}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
) const}}\label{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a75296f65ccebe075504744bb01218ac9}


Less than operator. 

Compares whether this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} is considered less than the other given \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}.

\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
This operator is primarily supplied so \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} objects can be stored in a std\-::map.
\end{DoxyNote}
Less than is defined by the number of components in a \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}, and if two paths have the same number of components then this resorts to a U\-T\-F8\-String less than comparison of the Unix paths.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em other} & \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} to compare this against. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
Whether this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} is less than the other. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

\hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_aa50a4cd5e59861d5f92050e13fb1a9ce}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!operator+@{operator+}}

\subsubsection[{operator+}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf Path} chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path\-::operator+ (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf Path} \&}]{other}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
) const}}\label{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_aa50a4cd5e59861d5f92050e13fb1a9ce}


Addition operator. 

Creates a new \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} by extending the components of this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} with the components of the other given \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}.

Example usage\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p1;
p1 << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"two"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"part"};

\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p2;
p2 << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"file.txt"};

\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p3 = p1 + p2;
\textcolor{comment}{// p3 contains [ "two", "part", "path", "to", "file.txt" ]}
\end{DoxyCode}
 \hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a6b89728f3dc58d20f21d3d5b6557ae2b}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!operator+=@{operator+=}}
\index{operator+=@{operator+=}!chaos::io::file::Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}}
\subsubsection[{operator+=}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}const {\bf Path}\& chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path\-::operator+= (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf Path} \&}]{other}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a6b89728f3dc58d20f21d3d5b6557ae2b}


Compound addition operator. 

Extends this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} with the components of the other given \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}.

Example usage\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p1;
p1 << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"two"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"part"};

\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p2;
p2 << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"file.txt"};

p1 += p2;
\textcolor{comment}{// p1 contains [ "two", "part", "path", "to", "file.txt" ]}
\end{DoxyCode}
 \hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_ac387ee9adf8455686998c392eebae4a8}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!operator$<$$<$@{operator$<$$<$}}
\index{operator$<$$<$@{operator$<$$<$}!chaos::io::file::Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}}
\subsubsection[{operator$<$$<$}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf Path}\& chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path\-::operator$<$$<$ (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-T\-F8\-String} \&}]{component}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_ac387ee9adf8455686998c392eebae4a8}


Join operator. 

Appends a new component to end of this path. This is the same as using the \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a94c5bfc90cdbf2096962f1bf03c9be7c}{join()} function.

Example usage\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p;
p << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"file.txt"};
\textcolor{comment}{// p now contains [ "path", "to", "file" ]}
\end{DoxyCode}



\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em component} & String to be appended to the end of this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} as a component. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
Reference to this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} after the join has taken place. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a94c5bfc90cdbf2096962f1bf03c9be7c}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!join@{join}}
\index{join@{join}!chaos::io::file::Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}}
\subsubsection[{join}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf Path}\& chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path\-::join (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-T\-F8\-String} \&}]{component}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a94c5bfc90cdbf2096962f1bf03c9be7c}


Appends a new component to the end of this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}. 

Since this returns a non-\/const reference to this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}, these functions can be chained.

Example usage\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p;
p.\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a94c5bfc90cdbf2096962f1bf03c9be7c}{join}( \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"} ).\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a94c5bfc90cdbf2096962f1bf03c9be7c}{join}( \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"} ).\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a94c5bfc90cdbf2096962f1bf03c9be7c}{join}( \textcolor{stringliteral}{"file.txt"} );
\textcolor{comment}{// p now contains [ "path", "to", "file" ]}
\end{DoxyCode}



\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em component} & \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-T\-F8\-String} to be appended to the end of this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} as a component. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
Reference to this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} after the join has taken place. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a974a945f9c1971eddf672717ea32ac3d}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!insert@{insert}}
\index{insert@{insert}!chaos::io::file::Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}}
\subsubsection[{insert}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path\-::insert (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{size\-\_\-t}]{index, }
\item[{const {\bf chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-T\-F8\-String} \&}]{component}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a974a945f9c1971eddf672717ea32ac3d}


Inserts the component at the given index in this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}. 

If the index is less than the length of the string, the component currently at the index and all following components will be shuffled along one position.

If the index is equal to the current number of components in this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}, this function is the same as calling \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a94c5bfc90cdbf2096962f1bf03c9be7c}{join()}.

If the index is greater than the number of components in this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}, an exception will be thrown.

Example usage\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} p;
p << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"file.txt"};
p.\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a974a945f9c1971eddf672717ea32ac3d}{insert}( 1, \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"} );
\textcolor{comment}{// p now contains ["path", "to", "file.txt"]}
\end{DoxyCode}



\begin{DoxyExceptions}{Exceptions}
{\em \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1ex_1_1_index_out_of_bounds_error}{chaos\-::ex\-::\-Index\-Out\-Of\-Bounds\-Error}} & If the provided index is greater than the number of components currently in this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path}.\\
\hline
\end{DoxyExceptions}

\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em index} & Position to insert the new component at. \\
\hline
{\em component} & \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-T\-F8\-String} representing the new component to be inserted. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\hypertarget{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a2cf2f806bd7e8969c6cd215271c0e104}{\index{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}!get\-\_\-components@{get\-\_\-components}}
\index{get\-\_\-components@{get\-\_\-components}!chaos::io::file::Path@{chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path}}
\subsubsection[{get\-\_\-components}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}const std\-::vector$<$ {\bf chaos\-::str\-::\-U\-T\-F8\-String} $>$\& chaos\-::io\-::file\-::\-Path\-::get\-\_\-components (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
) const}}\label{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path_a2cf2f806bd7e8969c6cd215271c0e104}


Returns the individual components which make up this path. 

For example the native Linux path\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
path/to/file.txt
\end{DoxyCode}


Stored correctly in a \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{Path} object\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1file_1_1_path}{chaos::io::file::Path} path;
path << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"file.txt"};
\end{DoxyCode}


Would contain the components\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
[ \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"}, \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"}, \textcolor{stringliteral}{"file.txt"} ]
\end{DoxyCode}
